task.title: Installing Demandware UX Studio for Early Access

taskbody.prereq:
The Demandware plugin is officially supported for:
Indigo - Eclipse 3.7
Juno - Eclipse 4.2
To run these versions of Eclipse you must use JDK 1.7. Demandware Studio requires that you use Eclipse IDE for Java EE Developers. See http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/packages/eclipse-ide-java-ee-developers/junosr1.

context.p: Demandware UX Studio is installed as a plugin for Eclipse. You must first install eclipse and then open it and install the Demandware Studio plugin.

step.cmd: Download Eclipse from http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/ and follow the instructions for installation.
Double-click eclipse.exe in your extraction location to run Eclipse. For more information on starting Eclipse, consult the Eclipse documentation.
In Eclipse, from the main menu, select Help > Install New Software.
Click Add. The Add Repository dialog appears.
In the Name field, enter Demandware UX Studio.
In the Location field, enter the URL for your version of Eclipse:

Select Demandware from the list and select Next. At this point Eclipse will compare the UX Studio requirements with what is available to ensure compatibility. After this process is complete, the Install Details dialog appears.
Select Next in the Install Details dialog. The Review Licenses dialog appears.
Select the license agreement radio button and then select Finish. The Installing Software dialog appears showing the progress of the installation.
Select OK in the Security Warning dialog.
Select Yes when prompted to restart Eclipse. UX Studio is now installed.

postreq.p: You may also want to Configure automatic updates for Studio.
